Package map_editor

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MapRenderStrategy
    This interface represent abstract strategy for map rendering.The classes which implements this interface represents concrete strategies for map rendering.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Map
    The function of Map class is to fill screen background with smaller images and set positions of game objects.To use this class user must fill its matrix(Map.map,Map.spriteList and Map.backgraundImages.The value before # at matrix[y][x] is the index of image in Map.backgraundImages which will be draw at position(x*filedWidth,y*filedHeight).The value after is the index of Sprite2D in Map.spriteList which move to position(x*filedWidth,y*filedHeight).
    MapUtility
    his is utility class for map editing.It contains methods for map functionalities.
    PositionStrategy
    The PositionStrategy is the simplest implementation of MapRenderStrategy.This strategy only draw map fields at position(x*filedWidth,y*filedHeight) without any scaling and other image transformations.
    ScaleStrategy
    The ScaleStrategy is the implementation of MapRenderStrategy.This strategy scale all background images(Map.getBackgraundImages()) and sprites(Map.getSpriteList()) before drawing.After scaling size of all images and sprites will be equal to map field size.
Author:
Comexetina
